title.narrative: APSED-Monitoring and Evaluation Assistance to WRPO and SEARO

description.narrative: Australia provides $12million over four years to support the implementation of the Asia-Pacific Strategy for Emerging Diseases (APSED) managed jointly by WHO-South East Asia Region (SEARO) and WHO-Western Pacific Region (WPRO). Assistance in Monitoring and Evaluation will be provided to address key concerns expressed by donor countries as well as the Technical Advisory Group of APSED. The assistance will be in the form of an agreed consultant working closely with WPRO and SEARO to develop one Monitoring and Evaluation system framework and performance criteria. These will be submitted to the TAG in July 2009. The total value of this initiative is $42.3 thousand expensed in the 2008-09 financial year.
